result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrin Alan Gruenberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Darrin Alan Gruenberg is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Darrin Alan Gruenberg was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3-19-2019 Court amends JOC from imposed and stayed sentence to straight jail sentence. Original probation sentence 1/27/2017 vacated.
Defendant allowed good time credit. Defendant to be allowed huber so long as reports and remains alcohol and controlled substance free.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence currently serving.

Laura Kohl for the State. Clerk ask for correction on the JOC. DOC called and needed language added to the JOC stating the original probation sentence has been vacated. Court does not object and orders the same.

Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney. Defendant Darrin Alan Gruenberg appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Laura Kohl appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court allows Mr Gruenberg to summerize his motion. DA Nolen notes the defendant cannot revoke probation before it starts, and agree to resentence the defendant if Court agrees. Court questions the defendant in regard to be present for this proceeding. Defendant waives any right to be present for the resentencing.

Darrin Alan Gruenberg, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Philip J. Brehm. Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney. DA Nolen withdraws the amended complaint - charges reverting back to the original 5 counts filed March 2016. State complied with Act 81 Victim Witness Notification. Plea Questionaire filed. No Contest plea entered on original Count 1. Court advises defendant of rights.  Elements stated.  Factual basis found. Parties address sentencing recommendation.
  Defendant advised of post conviction relief.
After calendar call - DA Nolen noted 21 days credit.
Petition for waiver is granted
appointing Guardian ad litem of Attorney

Order for Transport for Darrin A. Gruenberg DOB: 09-24-1970 from Waupun Correctional Institution.
to the Court of conflict of interest filed by Defendant

Darrin Alan Gruenberg, defendant appeared in Court by phone with counsel Joseph Pecora in person.
Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney.
Clerk called Waupun Correctional at 10:35 a.m.  Atty Pecora speaks privately with DE Gruenberg.
Case called at 11:35 a.m.  Atty Gruenberg objects to counsel refusal to file motions.
Atty Pecora addresses status of representation as to issue of previous representation of victim, Gene I.
DE Gruenberg interrupts, directing Atty Pecora to file motions, claiming constitutional rights and refuses to listen to Judge Vale and Atty Pecora.
Phone call terminated at the Judge's request 11:40 a.m.  as DE refused to allow the court to speak.
Court reviews, on the record, the status of attorney representation  on behalf of DE Gruenberg.  Court finds DE Gruenberg has forfeited his right to counsel as appointed.
DA Nolen requests trial remain as scheduled and asks for motion hearing and moves for leave to file amended complaint.
Atty Pecora declines to stand by as counsel for DE Gruenberg.  Court to appoint stand by counsel after the hearing today.
DE Gruenberg is to appear for Jan 27, 2016 hearing and Motion hearing scheduled for February 28, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Clerk contacts the correctional facility to connect with DE Gruenberg.  Correctional facility calls in.
Darrin Alan Gruenberg, defendant appeared in Court in custody by phone from correctional facility with counsel Joseph Pecora in person.
Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney.
Court notes amended complaint filed today.  Atty Pecora states he is engaged in plea negotiations with the DA, but the JT is still scheduled at this time.
DA Nolen addresses the changes in the amended complaint charges.
Gruenberg asks question as to repeater penalty.  Atty Pecora responds to his client's question.  Gruenberg officially objects to the amended filing on the record.
Telephone status set for Jan 27, 2017 at 2:30 p.m.  Jury instructions and motions to be filed by that date.
Atty Pecora requests to go on the record as to the matter of disclosure of past representation of Gene I.  When asked directly as to his objection, Gruenberg stated this would be discussed at a later time.  Atty Pecora requests objection or no be addressed at this time.  Phone call disconnected.  On the record DA Nolen addressed Atty Pecora's previous representation concerns.  Atty Pecora requests DA Nolen and his client, Gruenberg go on the record re: any objection as to conflict.  DA Nolen states on the record there is no objection to Atty Pecora representing Mr Gruenberg.
Clerk called correctional (920) 324-1156.  The operator transferred to the call room, where there was no answer.  Judge speaks to the operator.  Atty Pecora speaks to operator and requests phone conference today with Gruenberg.  Operator transfers to Angie, who attempts to transfer to the call room at 1:56 p.m. to get Gruenberg on the line.  1:58 p.m. the call transferred back to Angie who indicates Gruenberg refuses to pick up the phone and answer the call.  Atty Pecora requests a phone conference ASAP.  Angie indicates the first possible scheduling is next week.  Atty Pecora declines to schedule.  Call is ended.  Atty Pecora will attempt to make contact with client, Gruenberg and contact the judicial asst for scheduling another phone conference re: conflict issue.
Off the record - parties respond Notes OK to clerk's inquiry as to notes.

Darrin Alan Gruenberg 184979, defendant appeared in Court in custody with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney.
 Defendant given complaint.   Defendant objects to Atty Taylor's answer to the court.  Atty Taylor exits the courtroom.
  Court advises defendant of rights.  Defendant advised of right to Attorney.  Court notes SPD offer to represent DE and DE objection.    Defendant referred to apply with State Public Defender.  DE states he will never waive his right to atty.  Court - DE has refused to sign paperwork for SPD.    Defendant referred to apply with Judge's office for Court Appointed Attorney.  Court reviews DEs financial on the record.  Court indicates DE would probably qualify for SPD but has to submit the completed paperwork.  Court - behavior can forfeit a DEs right to an atty.
  Court reads complaint. Court advises defendant of charges and penalties.
DE requests record reflect pro se motions for speedy trial and discovery that have not been addressed.  Court advises DE of the time begins at point of initial.  Court again refers defendant to apply with State Public Defender and option to enter a plea.  Cautions a request for speedy trial without advice of counsel.
  Not Guilty plea entered by defendant and demands a speedy trial.  JT set for March 1-2, 2017.  12 person JT.  Panel 36.  4 strikes.  1 Alternate.
Clerk prepared SIBS - DE refused to sign SIBS.  Court addresses the DEs decision and indicates DE will be held without bail. (bond revoked)
DA asks motion in limine be set to address DEs motions.  Court will address motion to dismiss today.  DE objects as no representation today.  Court - DE has not addressed court as to grounds for deficiency of complaint.  Court denies both motions of DE.  Court finds complaint satisfies preliminary stages to find probable cause.  Court indicates appointed or retained counsel can renew these motions.
Court sets telephone status to confirm counsel for DE.  DE refuses to attend electronic proceedings.  Court addresses the telephone status set and DEs refusal to appear by phone.  DE agrees to appear by phone for the Jan 13 telephone status.
DE notes and states for the record the alleged victim's name.  Court notes the victim has been reflected by his initials.
from Defendant
to transport
Initial appearance on January 5, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Darrin Alan Gruenberg 184979, defendant does not appear in Court.
Angela K, Program Asst Confidential with Restricted Housing Unit at Waupun Correctional, states on the record that Darrin Gruenberg refuses to come out of his cell and take the call - "No I am not coming out."
Court states on the record - a letter from DE Gruenberg directly to the court indicating his refusal to cooperate with the court, declining SPD representation.  Confirms outdate March 23, 2019.
DA Nolen - to prepare a writ for DE to physically appear at future court proceeding.  Motions filed by DE in the spring were not provided to the State.
Court - DE has not physically appeared on this matter and has requested substitution of Judge, appt of counsel refusing to accept SPD representation.
INIT set for Jan 5, 2017 with notice to SPD.

records.addlTxt: for Court appointed counsel
Defendant has made oral request for substitution of judge and Judge Beer has granted the request on the record at the hearing on April 13, 2016.

Darrin Alan Gruenberg, defendant appeared in Court by phone means without counsel. Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney.  Court advises defendant of rights. Defendant has no counsel present. March 16th, copy of complaint mailed to Dodge Correctional Institution. Defendant does not wish to make any statements while without counsel. Matter referred to State Public Defender's Office. Atty Luhman to relay that to the Public Defender. Defendant retains right to request substitution of judge. Until initial appearance is made, cannot set bond. After Initial Appearance, defendant wishes to appear in person.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Initial appearance on April 13, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
